definition: to take the lead/to show initiative

sentences.english: The first use of cemented fragmental rock filling in China was conducted atTongkeng tin mine operated by Dachang Mine Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 大厂铜坑锡矿在国内率先使用块石砂浆胶结充填法。

sentences.english: Low-alcohol Lujiu (liquors produced in Shandong) is the first to enter national market in quantities.
sentences.chinese: 低度鲁酒率先大批量地走向全国市场。

sentences.english: Guangzhou is expected to take the lead in collecting light pollution fees in the country.
sentences.chinese: 广州市将率先在全国开征光污染排污费。

sentences.english: They also called on the G-8 industrialized nations to lead the way in enforcing laws already on the books.
sentences.chinese: 他们还呼吁西方八国率先实施已制定的法律。

sentences.english: Changhong made the first step towards the goal.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，长虹公司率先走出了第一步。

sentences.english: Fujian is the first province in the country to reform collective forest property right.
sentences.chinese: 福建省率先在全国开展集体林产权制度改革。

sentences.english: Aurora introduced one of the first cell-phone-guided walking tours offered in America.
sentences.chinese: 奥罗拉是美国率先引进电池电话导航旅游的地方。

sentences.english: The main leaders of the Party Committee in Jiangxi province proposed that Xinyu take the lead to realize the city and countryside integration.
sentences.chinese: 省委主要领导要求新余在全省率先实现城乡一体化。

sentences.english: We have pioneered research to better understand the root causes of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 我们率先开展了研究，以更好地认识腐败的根源。

sentences.english: Take the lead in Taizhou of Jiangsu Province City pilot compiled an overall land use planning.
sentences.chinese: 率先在江苏省泰州市试点编制土地利用总体规划。

sentences.english: His mother is Austrian took the lead in studying medicine, one of the women.
sentences.chinese: 他的母亲是奥国率先学习医科的妇女之一。

sentences.english: He acted as pioneer in proposing the method.
sentences.chinese: 他是率先创导这一方法的人。

sentences.english: Our company has taken the lead in establishing Harbin Zhongda Research Institute for profiles doors and windows among the same industry.
sentences.chinese: 在同行业中率先成立了哈尔滨市中大塑料门窗研究所。

sentences.english: Marx and Engels were the first socialists to support trade unions.
sentences.chinese: 率先支持工会运动的社会主义者也是马克思和恩格斯。

sentences.english: Simultaneously Our company primitively set up the special equipment liability insurance mechanism in China.
sentences.chinese: 同时我公司在国内率先设立专门的设备责任保险机制。

sentences.english: Tusk said they had been the first to offer condolences.
sentences.chinese: 图斯克表示，他们已率先吊唁。

definition: to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
